design_audit.model_formula: VAR(5) on [TFP, GDP, Consumption, Hours, GZ_spread, SP500, Inflation] with medium-run (MFEVD) identification of TFP news shock
design_audit.selection_story: Bayesian VAR with Minnesota prior (hyper-parameters chosen by BIC). TFP news shock identified via medium-run MFEVD: the shock that maximizes the forecast error variance of TFP at the VAR horizon (h=40), subject to zero contemporaneous impact on TFP. IRFs and FEVDs computed from posterior draws.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Impulse response of real GDP to a TFP news shock
claim_object.treatment_concept: Structural TFP news shock (1 std dev) identified via medium-run MFEVD
claim_object.estimand_concept: Cumulative impulse response of GDP to a 1 std dev TFP news shock at horizon h=8 quarters

constraints.notes: Paper uses 5 VAR lags and 7 variables as baseline (Figure 1). Key spec choices: number of lags, which financial variable (GZ spread vs EBP vs default risk vs bank equity), sample period (full vs excluding Great Recession), identification scheme (MFEVD news vs max-FEV financial shock), variable ordering, IRF horizon for measurement.

canonical.notes: Bayesian posterior credible intervals from Normal-Inverse-Wishart posterior draws (16th/84th percentiles as in paper)

variants.notes: Frequentist OLS VAR with residual bootstrap confidence intervals
